column4: that page is about trying to differentiate between pressed CDs and CD-Rs
I want to check that the burn was good.  I'm getting a "failed to copy file from cdrom" error on boot
you might be able to run the standard CD integrity check in expert mode, but it won't mean much on the live CD
if you're getting an error like that, it's very likely that the burn is bad
hmmm - knoppix has always had a nice way on live boot to check the cdrom.  What does cdrom-checker do if not that?

from this page I get the sense that a cd can be burned to always check integrity.  but perhaps not as an option?  odd...  http://www.ubuntulinux.org/wiki/HoaryHedgehogBurnDetection/view?searchterm=cdrom-checker
hmm, in fact cdrom-checker will check the live CD data, now that I look
yeah, but with the goal of checking integrity.  why would live cds not have that option?  what were you  saying about doing  it in expert mode?
the reason why the live CD might not have that option is because it might not be implemented yet
you should be able to run an integrity check from there
I'll look again - but don't remember it being obvious the first time around (though I wasn't looking for it then)
I just saw it also - many thanks!!
bingo.  I'll try burning for the  third time, more slowly....
